title: Gunmen kill New Zealand helicopter pilot in Indonesia's Papua, indigenous passengers freed
content: In Indonesia's Papua region, gunmen, allegedly from the West Papua Liberation Army, killed New Zealand pilot Glen Malcolm Conning after landing in Mimika district. The helicopter was set ablaze while Indigenous Papuan passengers were released. The attackers retreated into the jungle. The incident has heightened tensions between Indigenous Papuans and Indonesian authorities.
summary: In Indonesia's Papua region, gunmen, allegedly from the West Papua Liberation Army, killed New Zealand pilot Glen Malcolm Conning after landing in Mimika district. The helicopter was set ablaze while Indigenous Papuan passengers were released. The attackers retreated into the jungle. The incident has heightened tensions between Indigenous Papuans and Indonesian authorities.

title: Tropical storm Debby ravages Florida and Georgia: Many dead, cities flooded
content: Tropical Storm Debby caused severe damage across the southeastern US, leading to several deaths, mass evacuations, and extensive flooding. Rescue operations are ongoing in Florida and Georgia, with over 500 people saved from flooded homes. Power outages affected more than 300,000 people as authorities urged residents to stay vigilant, with the storm still posing significant threats.
summary: Tropical Storm Debby caused severe damage across the southeastern US, leading to several deaths, mass evacuations, and extensive flooding. Rescue operations are ongoing in Florida and Georgia, with over 500 people saved from flooded homes. Power outages affected more than 300,000 people as authorities urged residents to stay vigilant, with the storm still posing significant threats.

US passes message to Iran not to escalate at 'critical moment' for Middle East
content: The U.S. urged other nations to convey to Iran that escalating Middle East tensions isn't in their interest. Secretary of State Antony Blinken emphasized the need for restraint and diplomacy, amid fears of Iranian retaliation against Israel following the assassinations of Hamas and Hezbollah leaders. President Biden and Vice President Harris were briefed on the situation and U.S. response efforts.
summary: The U.S. urged other nations to convey to Iran that escalating Middle East tensions isn't in their interest. Secretary of State Antony Blinken emphasized the need for restraint and diplomacy, amid fears of Iranian retaliation against Israel following the assassinations of Hamas and Hezbollah leaders. President Biden and Vice President Harris were briefed on the situation and U.S. response efforts.

US State Dept urges 'calm and restraint' in Bangladesh, after PM Sheikh Hasina flees
content: The United States called for calm after Bangladesh's Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled amid deadly protests. The protests began over job quotas but evolved into a larger movement. The US expressed condolences for those affected and urged for an orderly transition, criticizing Hasina's authoritarian inclinations and the resulting violence.
summary: The United States called for calm after Bangladesh's Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina resigned and fled amid deadly protests. The protests began over job quotas but evolved into a larger movement. The US expressed condolences for those affected and urged for an orderly transition, criticizing Hasina's authoritarian inclinations and the resulting violence.

title: US Supreme Court declines to lift Trump’s gag order in hush money case
content: The Supreme Court rejected Missouri's request to delay Donald Trump's sentencing and lift a gag order before the 2024 election. Trump was found guilty in May of falsifying business records to conceal a payment of $130,000 made to adult film actress Stormy Daniels, in exchange for her silence regarding a sexual encounter she claimed to have had with Trump in the past, prior to the 2016 US election.
summary: The Supreme Court rejected Missouri's request to delay Donald Trump's sentencing and lift a gag order before the 2024 election. Trump was found guilty in May of falsifying business records to conceal a payment of $130,000 made to adult film actress Stormy Daniels, in exchange for her silence regarding a sexual encounter she claimed to have had with Trump in the past, prior to the 2016 US election.

title: Bangladesh president orders release of jailed ex-PM Khaleda Zia as Sheikh Hasina flees country
content: Bangladeshi president Mohammed Shahabuddin ordered the release of former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, following the military ousting of Sheikh Hasina. This decision, made during a meeting with military and opposition leaders, included freeing all those arrested during recent protests. General Waker announced the formation of an interim government after Hasina fled the country amid violent unrest.
summary: Bangladeshi president Mohammed Shahabuddin ordered the release of former Prime Minister Khaleda Zia, following the military ousting of Sheikh Hasina. This decision, made during a meeting with military and opposition leaders, included freeing all those arrested during recent protests. General Waker announced the formation of an interim government after Hasina fled the country amid violent unrest.

title: Mark Kelly's cryptic tweets leaves netizens confused about Kamala Harris' VP pick
content: US Senator Mark Kelly's cryptic social media posts on X, formerly known as Twitter, caused controversy in the Democratic Party. The initial post, suggesting Kelly was no longer considered as Kamala Harris's running mate, was quickly deleted. Kelly later clarified his dedication to serving Arizonans, emphasizing his military and NASA background.
summary: US Senator Mark Kelly's cryptic social media posts on X, formerly known as Twitter, caused controversy in the Democratic Party. The initial post, suggesting Kelly was no longer considered as Kamala Harris's running mate, was quickly deleted. Kelly later clarified his dedication to serving Arizonans, emphasizing his military and NASA background.

title: How quota unrest led to Sheikh Hasina's resignation as PM in Bangladesh: A timeline
content: Amidst political chaos in Bangladesh, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina stepped down and fled to Delhi after intense protests led to violence and the breach of her palace. The military took control, promising an interim government. The unrest stemmed from a controversial job quota for descendants of freedom fighters, increasing unemployment, and economic stagnation.
summary: Amidst political chaos in Bangladesh, Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina stepped down and fled to Delhi after intense protests led to violence and the breach of her palace. The military took control, promising an interim government. The unrest stemmed from a controversial job quota for descendants of freedom fighters, increasing unemployment, and economic stagnation.
